metadata.title: About
metadata.description: Learn more about me and my work.

hero.name: Otobong Okoko
hero.mission: I help shape how millions of people experience customer care at Europe's biggest fashion platform.
story: I'm a systems thinker who operates in both design and code. This dual perspective lets me bridge what users need with what's possible to build. I speak both designers' and developers' languages, which makes collaboration flow naturally. I'm naturally curious, maybe annoyingly so - constantly asking questions that uncover better solutions.

Let's build something meaningful together. If you're looking for a designer who thinks strategically, codes functionally, and questions relentlessly, I'd love to collaborate. Reach out - let's talk about how we can create products that actually work for people.

principles.title: My Design Principles
principles.description: Design principles aren't aspirational statements. They're decision-making frameworks. The best ones create productive tension, forcing you to choose what matters most when trade-offs become inevitable. They acknowledge constraints rather than ignore them. And they're only valuable if they actually shape how you work.

items.title: Show, Don't Overwhelm
items.description: Complexity should be revealed gradually, not dumped on users all at once. Start simple. Demonstrate competence step by step. Users gain confidence through progressive discovery - not by seeing everything upfront.

items.title: Include, Don't Retrofit
items.description: Accessibility and cultural diversity shape the foundation - they don't get added later. Design for different thinking styles, communication preferences, and interaction needs from day one. Compliance is the baseline. True inclusion is the goal.

items.title: Fix Systems, Not Symptoms
items.description: Surface problems usually point to deeper issues. Address root causes through interconnected solutions rather than patching individual pain points. Sustainable design solves for the system, not just the screen.

items.title: Validate, Then Build
items.description: Every significant design decision should be backed by evidence - user insights, behavioral data, or tested assumptions. Intuition starts the conversation, but research validates the direction. Make design choices defensible.
